results.title: Drat
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Sarah Watt and Elizabeth O'Neill
results.brief_description: A bunch of lab rats one night decide to break out and escape from their cages in the laboratory. One brain damaged rat, as a result of receiving shock-treatment, initially resists the call. This claymation reveals in its close yet another fiendish experiment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Sarah Watt and Elizabeth O’Neill

results.title: Drama school
results.creator_credit: Hilton Cordell Productions, Seven Network Limited (Australia), TV 3 New Zealand, Trouble, Chris Hilton, Michael Cordell, Rachel Landers and Kate Bannatyne
results.brief_description: Television documentary series in the ‘reality TV’ genre that follows a year in the life of students at Australia’s best known drama school, the National Institute for Dramatic Art (NIDA) in Sydney. The series begins with the gruelling audition process, then charts the progress of the successful candidates through their first year of the three year course. Simultaneously, the challenges faced by the students who have made it to third year are documented, as they prepare for graduation and entry into the professional world of acting. The series places a strong emphasis on the personal struggles of the students as they face the challenges involved in learning to become professional actors. Contents: Tape 1: Ep. 1 The Auditions—Ep. 2 D-Day—Ep. 3 Boot Camp NIDA—Ep. 4 The Queen—Ep. 5 This Glamorous Life. Tape 2: Ep. 6 Stage Fright—Ep. 7 Agent’s Week—Ep. 8 The Never Ending Audition—Ep. 9 The Final Curtain. Each episode is 30 minutes in duration. Cast includes: NIDA actors: Zoe Houghton, Anthony Radojevic, Romy Bartz, Thom Campbell, Genevive O’Reilly, Socratis Otto, Amie McKenna, Lauren Steenholdt, Daniel Billet. Visiting director: Barrie Kosky. NIDA staff: Tony Knight, Julia Cotton, Kevin Jackson, Bill Pepper, Tim Patston. Music by David Bridie. Narrated by Sacha Horler.

results.title: Drama lesson
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Richard Mason and Joe Scully
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the system of ‘creative drama’ being practiced in some Australian schools. The system aims to stimulate the imagination of the children. Encourages children to improvise and recreate situations based on their experiences. Includes a film made by an improvisation and discusses the planning of its action. Drama teacher Jean Stuart and students from Fort Street Girls High School and Vaucluse Boy’s Hight School appear in this documentary.

results.title: Drama is...
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Rob McCubbin
results.brief_description: To promote drama as a method which teachers should have in their armoury of skills. It shows how drama can be integrated into the total curriculum, and how it can be about coming to grips with real problems and about caring, sharing and understanding.

results.title: Dragonwyk
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F Zanuck Productions, Darryl F. Zanuck and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Brooding, gothic thriller about a beautiful, naive country girl whose dreams of a grander life are realised with her sophisticated and urbane cousin who resides at the palatial estate, “Dragonwyck”. Dazzled by his social mobility and wealth, Miranda is soon betrothed to the faintly menacing Nicholas, but the marriage becomes wretched as Nicholas’ true nature is revealed. Shades of “Rebecca” (1940) hang over this mystery drama, but the Hitcockian tones are diluted in favour of a more romantic tone. What remains is an engaging, and at times suspenseful, murder mystery. Directorial debut of screenwriter and producer Joseph L. Mankiewicz.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F Zanuck Productions, Darryl F. Zanuck and Joseph L Mankiewicz
